intro: Euonymus oukiakensis, commonly known as the Korean spurge or Japanese euonymus, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Cercidiphyllaceae and is characterized by its opposite, simple, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange-red berries that are distinctive and visually striking. Euonymus oukiakensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal color changes. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it adaptable to various garden environments.
